context: The word 'jääge' is the plural imperative form of the Estonian verb 'jääma', which means to stay or remain. It's used when giving a command or request to multiple people telling them to stay somewhere, or indicating that something will be left behind. The form 'jääge' specifically addresses you (plural) - it would be different for singular address (jäi) or formal/plural third person (jäävad).
